a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, double, i.e. second; also adverbially, again

to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
near, with or among; often in general, to

to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)

4.brief: properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a walk, i.e. a passage or a distance
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert

5.brief: properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance)

6.brief: properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
near, with or among; often in general, to
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
something ample (as a large vine, a wide dress)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

7.brief: to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
properly, a taste, i.e. (figuratively) perception; by implication, intelligence; transitively, a mandate
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
beef cattle or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for plowing); collectively, a herd
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
properly, a speck or point, i.e. (by implication) something; with negative, nothing
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
